item.title: Damaged Traffic Island High Street Penge preventing safe crossing of road for pedestrians, 18th February
item.description:
Damaged Traffic Island Crystal Palace Park Road/ High Street Penge due to speeding driver crashing into it, preventing safe crossing of road for pedestrians. For at least 3 months the traffic island has been wrecked by a speeding driver, who has crashed into it, and has rendered the crossing unusable. This crossing is important for access to and from Penge West station and is required for anyone wishing to transfer between Penge East and Penge West stations. I would like to raise the problem of speeding on this road on the southbound lane, since I can recall this exact same issue occurring at least three times in the past few years, with dangerous drivers speeding down the hill and crashing into the concrete traffic island.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, High Street, Anerley, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A dead fox in a garden soil type bag, 18th February
item.description:
As you enter the path to the right of the golf course club house (running along by the allotment) you follow the path round and a minute or so walk in you will see a gardening bag with bricks on the end, there is a dead fox in the bag. I did make the ladies in the club house aware last week but it’s still there, it won’t be long before it starts rotting and smelling awful, the path is used by dog walkers and families.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayplace Road East, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Noisy loose manhole cover, 18th February
item.description:
This manhole cover is loose and makes a loud clanking noise when vehicles drive over. It is causing a nuisance to residents including disturbing sleep. We would appreciate it being fixed please. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 192, Crystal Palace Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inappropriate temporary traffic lights, 18th February
item.description:
The traffic lights for the current roadworks are not in a good place. They are causing unnecessary congestion and queues in both directions, particularly if heading towards Honor Oak. The main problem seems to be that the lights cause traffic to queue down the high street where there are parked cars on both sides. There isn’t space for buses and lorries to pass through and vehicles back up behind them and block the single lane roadwork area. When the lights change to the other direction cars cannot get through to create space on the high street and everything grinds to a standstill. There have been minor collisions as a result and it took me over half an hour to get through the roadworks yesterday. Pedestrians also ignore the closed crossing outside the station so cars in the single lane roadwork area have to stop to let them across, which means that traffic flow gets out of sync with the lights and the congestion gets worse. Please urgently look at improving this situation as it would be avoidable if the traffic lights were placed in better positions and the closed crossing was properly enforced. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honor Oak Park, Honor Oak, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
